sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"符合，一致"之意。
means: agree ：侧重指经过比较后的所有主要部分均和谐一致，无冲突和矛盾。
accord ：着重指性格、精神、语气或质量等方面的完全一致。
coincide ：多用于指观点、判断、愿望、利益或兴趣的一致或相符。偶尔用于人，强调意见或观点完全相同。
conform ：强调在形状、性格以及主要特点等方面的相似或一致。
correspond ：指在进行比较时，两个事物在某一个重要方面或细节上互相匹配、一致。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"协定，协议，契约，合同"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: agreement, contract, treaty, convention, bargain, understanding, accord
means: agreement ：普通用词，含义最确定，泛指个人、团体或国家之间取得一致而达成的任何协议、协定或合同、契约等，可以是口头的，也可以是书面的。
contract ：侧重指双方或多方订立的具有法律效力的正式的书面合同或契约。
treaty ：指国家之间经外交谈判后依照国际法签订的正式条约。
convention ：比treaty更专门化，但不及treaty正式。也可指国家之间就有关事情签订的条约。
bargain ：通常指商业交往中的购销合同。
understanding ：指不具约束力的非正式的协议。
accord ：多指国际间的非正式协议。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这组动词均含有"给予，赠给"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: give, accord, award, confer，grant, endow, present, bestow
means: give ： 最普通用词，泛指将自己的东西给予他人，所给予的东西，物质或非物质的均可。
accord ： 侧重所给予的是应得的或是恰当的，或是因某种原因而适于接受的。
award ： 通常暗示所给予的东西是接受者应得的，而且给予者往往是具有裁判权力的。
confer ： 通常指授予称号或学位等。
grant ： 多指出于慷慨、怜悯或正义感而给予，并且通常是在被请求下给予。
endow ： 指捐赠大量的钱作基金，也可指给予非物质的东西。
present ： 指正式地给予或授予，通常伴有仪式进行。
bestow ： 正式用词，指把某物作为礼物赠送于某人，也可作引申用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"和谐，一致"之意。
means: harmony ： 指人与人之间或不同部分与整体之间完全协调、和谐、愉快，没有摩擦。
agreement ： 侧重态度与观点上的一致。
concord ： 多指人际、国家间或民族之间协调一致的关系。
unity ： 指各个成员、各群体之间相互协调一致的关系。
accord ： 指思想一致，彼此不矛盾，也指行动上的一致。

sentence.Network_cn: 他辞去法国总理职务并非出于自愿。

sentence.Network_en: With one accord they turned and walked back over the grass.

sentence.Network_en: In many cases the disease will clear up of its own accord.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种病很多情况下会自愈。

lj.lj_ly: he would not seek treatment of his own accord.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English , from Old French acorder 'reconcile, be of one mind', from Latin ad- 'to' + cor, cord- 'heart'; influenced by concord

entry.tran: （国家、团体之间的正式）协定，协议，条约
entry.def: An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement, for example to end a war.

example.ex: ...a fitting way to celebrate the peace accord.
example.tran: 庆祝和平协定的恰当的方式

entry.def: If you are accorded a particular kind of treatment, people act towards you or treat you in that way.

example.ex: His predecessor was accorded an equally tumultuous welcome...
example.tran: 他的前任受到了同样热烈的欢迎。

example.ex: The government accorded him the rank of Colonel...

entry.def: If one fact, idea, or condition accords with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them.

example.ex: Such an approach accords with the principles of socialist ideology.
example.tran: 这种方法与社会主义意识形态的原则相符。

example.ex: ...scientific evidence that did not fully accord with the facts uncovered by the police.
example.tran: 与警方所掌握的情况不完全一致的科学证据

entry.def: If one person, action, or fact is in accord with another, they are in agreement and there is no conflict between them. You can also say that two people or things are in accord.

example.ex: ...this military action, taken in accord with United Nations resolutions...
example.tran: 依据联合国决议而采取的本次军事行动

example.ex: Old enemies can become new friends even if all their national interests are not in complete accord.
example.tran: 即使国家利益不尽相同，他们也可以化敌为友。

entry.def: If something happens of its own accord, it seems to happen by itself, without anyone making it happen.

example.ex: In many cases the disease will clear up of its own accord.
example.tran: 这种病很多情况下会自愈。

entry.def: If you do something of your own accord, you do it because you want to, without being asked or forced.

example.ex: He did not quit as France's prime minister of his own accord.
example.tran: 他辞去法国总理职务并非出于自愿。

entry.def: If a number of people do something with one accord, they do it together or at the same time, because they agree about what should be done.

example.ex: With one accord they turned and walked back over the grass.
example.tran: 他们步调一致地转身走过草坪。

means.word_mean: 1. harmony of people's opinions or actions or characters;

sentences.sentence: "we are in accord with your proposal"

means.word_mean: 3. a written agreement between two states or sovereigns

stems_affixes.value_cn: 相符的, 一致的, 根据……而定的
stems_affixes.word_buile: accord[n.&v.一致;符合]+ing形容词→adj.相符的, 一致的, 根据……而定的
cord心脏,一致+ial……的→adj.首要的,主要的
accord[n.&v.一致;符合]+ance表名词→n.一致,和谐,符合
cordial[adj.首要的,主要的]+ity表名词→n.诚心,热诚
discord[n.不和;不一致]+ance表名词→n.不协调;　不一致
ac加强+cord心脏,一致→心心相符
re一再+cord心脏,一致→一再放在心上→记录

sentences.en: They came to an accord that profits should be shared equally.
sentences.cn: 他们达成协议, 收益由大家均分。

means.word_mean: (尤指国与国之间的)谅解, 协议

sentences.en: The government expected a temporary accord with the Opposition before the end of the year.
sentences.cn: 政府期望年底以前和反对党达成临时协议。

means.word_mean: 给予, 赠予，授予（权力、地位、某种待遇）

sentences.en: We accorded the boy due praise.
sentences.cn: 我们给了孩子适当的表扬。

sentences.en: The committee accorded a scholarship to her.
sentences.cn: 委员会批准给她奖学金。
这两项声明表面上一致。

sentences.en: Most of my classmates accord in that opinion.
sentences.cn: 我们班大多数同学都是那个意见。

sentences.en: His story accords with what I saw.
sentences.cn: 他讲的与我看到的是吻合的。

jushi.english: He brought his views into accord with mine.
jushi.chinese: 他使自己的意见与我的意见协调起来。

jushi.english: Before 1987, the accord between the Labour government and the unions was a simple affair.
jushi.chinese: 1987年以前,工党政府与工会之间的协议很简单。

jushi.english: There are few issues on which the two are in perfect accord.
jushi.chinese: 双方几乎没有在什么问题上取得完全一致的意见。
